Sacru
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 3:43:59 PM

Can we add reactions to posts/replies? Seems like this would eliminate a lot of needless back & forth where the only real purpose is to communicate a positive, neutral, or negative reaction to a post? Said data could also offer a gateway to sorting threads or replies within those threads not only by views/responses, but also by number of reactions / upvotes.

Edit, for clarity: reactions in addition to the upvote caret. Emoticon-style.

Mogonis
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 3:47:52 PM

There's an up/down vote feature for individual posts, but I don't know if there's data or reporting on it.

Parkbandit
Wednesday, August 9th, 2017, 3:49:14 PM

I'm not sure we want to put too much into "grading" posts like that. I don't think it's fair to say give you a big smile reaction.. and someone who posts after you maybe just a small smile reaction.

We should all be treated as equals. Maybe every post you make, you automatically get a smile? I could get behind that effort.

Just a thought.

Yeah, the Stack system would work really well for Q&A, but not so much for discussion. A Q&A section following Stack-like mechanics (FOR mechanics questions??) would be pretty awesome, and would allow the real goods to float right to the top. Just like Stack.

Agree that downvoting could lead to unnecessary negativity. But also that reactions in general (even a calculator 'reaction' as suggested by @Cervantes would be cool) would be pretty awesome, so long as the total number of potential reactions is limited to 5-7.

This could add a valuable dimension to both UX, and available data, and there's no such thing as too much data.
